title: Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Woods Services in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview with HR. The second interview was through zoom and the third interview was onsite. There were two people to interview me. The interview went through almost 30 minutes. The interviewers were friendly.

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Woods Services
Interview Descriptions: Very personable and comfortable.  Interviewing was very professional yet make me feel like I could openly speak about my concerns.  She appears excited about working at Woods which put me at ease about my uncertainty about changing positions.

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Woods Services (Langhorne, PA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: It is laid back. They want to know that you have experience working with people that have special needs and/or behavioral disorders.  Because of COVID some people were interviewed via phone.  Before meeting with management, you are asked to write answers to some questions regarding why you want the job, what experience you have, etc.  This is partly.to ensure you will be able to document incidents effectively in English, although your writing skills do not have to be perfect at all.  During the interview they show you a residence or school where you may be hired.  Management is friendly and welcoming.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Woods Services (Langhorne, PA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick  and painless. The interviewer was very sweet. Nothing too interesting happened except for the interview starting 45 minutes behind schedule. We were finished quite quickly and explained the severity of how much they were in need of my position.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in this position?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly standard.  I applied and was contacted via phone to come to an interview about 3 days later. The interviewer was the supervisor at the time and he was pretty laid back and was straight forward about what the position entails.
Interview Questions: How do you handle someone who is difficult?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Woods Services (Langhorne, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very professional interview process. Background checks, finger prints, child abuse, drug tests, writing samples, etc. HR department are very kind and can answer any questions. You have to fill out a lot of paperwork, but all for protection and to see your background history.
Interview Questions: How would I handle certain situations on the job?

title: Staff Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Woods Services (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Strange process. Started at HR. Filled out paperwork/waited around for 45 minutes. Was sent to a building on the other side of campus. On arrival, was told I was in the wrong place (I followed HR's directions exactly, and went to the building that they wrote down on a map for me). I was sent to a different building where the staff was unprepared for an interview. They asked a few questions off the cuff and gave me a tour.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Woods Services (Langhorne, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening with recruiter. Stopped at HR to submit a writing sample and for them to copy my license/diploma, then interviewed with manager. High expectations for the RN; covering 3-4 units, and supervising medication techs who actually give the meds (requirement is 12 college credits and a training course). Beautiful campus, nice people, not nearly enough compensation for the responsibility expected! I withdrew myself from consideration after the interview.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable taking care of clients with extensive medical needs such as tube feedings and frequent seizures?

title: Program Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Woods Services (Langhorne, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application one night and got the call for an interview the very next day! She was very eager to have me come in and speak with me. The interview lasted almost 2 hours. She was very intrigued that I had come from a facility that had structure and she wanted that here. She brought in a clinical to speak with me as well. They were very sweet people.
Interview Questions: What will you do differently from the other supervisor we had to let go?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Woods Services (Langhorne, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It started off with a phone interview.  A few weeks later I was called in for an interview at HR.  There, we went over who I was, why I chose this field, and what unit would be best for me.  Then I took a drug test, a test of physical ability (e.g. kneeling, lifting 50lbs, etc.).  After that I was sent to my selected unit for an interview with the building manager.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this line of work?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Woods Services in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was with two house managers. They asked me normal interview questions and were very pleasant. I was very comfortable in the room. They were very laid back and did not apply a lot of pressure on me. I felt that the vibe in the room was very good. 

  They also asked me about my experience and background.  Although I never worked in a residential setting before, they were very open to me.

title: Staff Counselor III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Woods Services (Langhorne, PA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: At the point of application, it was best to hand deliver the resume and application to HR.  That day I was given a preliminary interview before the one for the actual job.  Within a week I was given the full interview for the job, and I received a call back a week from the interview date.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experience working with children.

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Woods Services (Langhorne, PA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Show up, fill out application (be able to write in English), they'll then call you to attend an interview during which I wasn't asked any questions just told where I was going to work and what to kinda expect.  2 week orientation (don't fall asleep). Don't have any major criminal background, complete childline check. Get some drug and disease tests. Start OJT by shadowing for a week. Done.
Interview Questions: Uh there were no questions at my interview, i just got told what I was going to do.
